definition: to speak cautiously/to guard one's tongue

sentences.english: Even the usually tongue-tied International Olympic Committee expressed regret at the remark.
sentences.chinese: 就連一向慎言的國際奧組委也對這句話表示遺憾。

sentences.english: Pre-Qin's concept of cautions in speech has profound effect in Chinese culture.
sentences.chinese: 先秦慎言觀念對中國傳統文化有着深遠的影響。

sentences.english: Please help us to do all we can to watch our words and guard against sin and temptation.
sentences.chinese: 求禰幫助我們慎言，以免犯罪和受試探。

sentences.english: You must be cautious when being interviewed by the press, or you might say something against yourself.
sentences.chinese: 接受媒體採訪時一定要慎言，不要被抓住了把柄。
